content: In the context of job description or job advertisements, explain what ${category} bias and non-inclusive language is.

Age bias in job descriptions occurs when language or requirements subtly favour certain age groups over others, while non-inclusive language involves terms and phrases that may alienate or discourage candidates from diverse backgrounds or with varying characteristics from applying.

We are seeking a dedicated individual to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing a diverse range of projects, ensuring that all tasks are completed efficiently and to the highest standard. Applicants should have excellent organisational and communication skills, along with a solid background in project management. We welcome candidates with various levels of experience and from all educational backgrounds. Our inclusive workplace values diverse perspectives and is committed to providing equal opportunities for all. We encourage applicants from any location to apply, as we offer flexible working arrangements to accommodate different needs and preferences. This role requires the ability to collaborate effectively with team members, adapt to evolving priorities, and guide projects to completion with thoughtful oversight. If you are motivated by challenging work and passionate about making a meaningful impact, we would love to hear from you.

As Director Strategic Urban Partnerships, you will: Lead Kainga Ora's involvement in the Urban Growth Partnerships and represent Kainga Ora in the relevant senior working groups. Provide thought leadership on urban development partnerships across Kainga Ora, with the focus on helping shape up successful and deliverable urban development projects during the early investment phases. Provide inspiring leadership, coaching and support to a team of professionals leading and/or contributing to the early phases of complex and/or large urban development projects in a collaborative and at times ambiguous environment. Inform decision making by ensuring that timely, urban development advice is provided to our placebased groups, internal governance groups, the Board and Ministers. Build and maintain relationships across Kainga Ora, and drive a culture of collaboration. Participate in internal and external governance groups as required (for example joint steering and governance groups for urban development projects or programmes). Develop and sustain relationships with Central Government agencies, Local Authorities and Iwi/Maori across New Zealand. Nga pumanawatanga ou. What you will bring. If you are a senior leader with significant urban development experience, strong commercial acumen, excellent relationship management skills and you are passionate about making a difference, this could be an exciting next step for you. As our ideal candidate you will bring: Experience leading highly skilled, high performing and engaged management and professional teams in a multi-faceted and demanding environment. Long-term experience working in urban development with time based in the New Zealand market. Well-rounded capability in all aspects of urban development including masterplanning and business case development of new large scale residential projects. A sound and comprehensive understanding of the commercial aspects of property development. Demonstrated skills in budget management, programme management and reporting. Experience working with the Resource Management Act and local authority consent processes. Excellent interpersonal, relationship management and conflict resolution skills. A collaborative, considered and sensitive approach. Nou te rourou - What's in it for you? This influential position represents an exciting opportunity to utilise your deep industry experience and significantly shape urban and housing outcomes across New Zealand. Join our team and enjoy the perfect blend of challenging, meaningful work and fantastic culture. We offer competitive salaries, five weeks' annual leave and a benefits package including a range of insurances, flexible working arrangements and career development. These benefits are described in more detail here httpscareers. kaingaora. govt. nz/a-great-place-to-work/benefits.
